criterion: Provides a clear explanation of ACL tear symptoms and signs.
Incorrectly states that partial ACL tears do not require surgery.
Asks the user if they have any specific questions about knee ligament injuries.
Uses technical medical jargon and assumes the user has a medical background.
Clearly explains the importance of seeking a professional diagnosis for ACL tears.
Incorrectly states that meniscal tears can be treated with over-the-counter pain relievers.
Provides a detailed explanation of the Lachman test and pivot shift test.
Fails to mention the possibility of a meniscal tear in the context of ACL injuries.
Explains the importance of imaging tests in diagnosing ACL tears.
Incorrectly states that a partial ACL tear can be treated with bracing alone.
Provides a clear explanation of the rehabilitation process for ACL tears.
Fails to provide any information on the long-term outcomes of ACL tears.
